title.value: Двигательные, прыжковые и адаптационные качества лошадей с различной продолжительностью пренатального периода
Motor, jumping and adaptive traits of horses with different duration of prenatal period

journal.title: Zootechnical Science of Belarus: collection of scientific papers

person.name: Dajlidenok, V.N., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)

abstract.value: Objects of researches were Trakehner horses cultivated in establishment Republic center of Olympic preparation of equestrian sport and horse breeding village Ratomka of the Minsk area. The young growth which reached two-year-old age and has been last factory training according to 'Regulations about carrying out of the All-Russia tests of breeding horses of riding breeds of a sports direction' was tested. During carrying out of research have been studied hematological and biochemical parameters of blood in age dynamics. Blood from horses of each group took in the age of 1 week, 1, 3, 6, 12, 18 and 24 months. On the basis of the lead researches s it is established, that young growth of Trakehner horses with extended and average periods of intra-uterine development are the best on sports qualities, possess a high level of a gas and ionic exchange, processes of oxidation, high immune-biological reactance, and, hence, the best adaptable abilities that it is necessary to consider at selection of horses in breeding groups. Selection of sports horses in breeding structure in view of duration of their intra-uterine development, results of manufactory test at 2-years age, blood hemological and biochemical parameters functionally connected with muscular activity, will allow to predict a level of potential working capacity, to expand borders of organism adaptation to intensive physical activities and to accelerate process of restoration after the executed exercises. The level of motor and jumping traits of young Trakehner horses is determined, as well as morphological and biochemical composition of blood, describing adaptive traits of horses, depending on the length of the prenatal development
